description: Buy the Wild Country Pro-Key Nut Tool + Leash online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Pro-Key Nut Tool + Leash
hasVariant.description: Buy the Wild Country Pro-Key Nut Tool + Leash online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Was stoked on this until I took it on the maiden voyage of my first wall. Maybe a surprise to hear for some but hammers are nice for removing bass stoppers on walls. I was blown away when the tool broke in half when I went to remove the second nut ever with it. Managed to use what was left for the wall but suspect this tool wasn’t designed to handle the force of a hammer. Will reporpose the leash but thought I’d mention it for other wall climbers that this isn’t a good option!
review.name: Not for Big wall climbing

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this nut tool about 5 years ago when I bought my Wild Country Classic Rocks. Amazingly, the leash helps when getting nitty gritty and removing a properly welded nut or some crag booty without dropping your tool at height. Once when teaching a beginner on the ground, they accidentally got my brand new cam stuck in an inwards flaring crack, I used the tool to chip away and open the granite enough to get my new toy back. The pro key didn't take the slightest damage as I sawed and bashed away at the tough quartzite granite. 
Pros: 
-> Durable 
-> Leash and carabiner style clip to keep it neat on the harness 
-> Slim profile w/ a large surface area to use it as a "hammer"
Cons: 
-> None
Suggestion: Similar to Metolius, I think cutouts usable to tighten bolts would be nice. I do not think this is a necessity or a downfall of the product. Also, I think the leash attachment part could be larger, but I have no issue with my Arcteryx AR385-a XS harness.
review.name: Wild Country (Super-Duper) Pro Leash

review.reviewBody: Does the job credibly. Everyone loves to have gear on a leash when we’re up high!
review.name: Solid product. No complaints

review.reviewBody: works perfect
really same as other keys, solid performance and build, comes with the leash and is a really great price
review.name: Cool Key

review.reviewBody: Does exactly what it’s supposed to. That’s about all there is to it!
Kinda hard to clip to some thicker gear loops but the leash is awesome
review.name: Best nut tool

review.reviewBody: This was sturdy enough not to feel cheep. The band on it is strong. Got caught in a rock when dropped and was perfectly fine. The surface area on the back side for knocking out nuts was small enough to be streamlined but also big enough to get a good clean, easy hit.
review.name: Strong and Super Useful

review.reviewBody: Used one of my friends pro key last summer. Really liked it so i bought one for myself.
review.name: I like the pro key with leash

review.reviewBody: Both of the clips are easy to use and sturdy.  The lanyard is strong and allows for a long stretch.  It would be nice of some of the voids within the frame were designed to fit common bolt heads.  The flat portion on the clip end is especially nice to have.  Saves your palm when you're trying to push a nut out.
review.name: One of the best nut tools out there.

name: Pro-Key Nut Tool + Leash

description: Buy the Outdoor Research Bug Bivy online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Bug Bivy
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Bug Bivy online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this at a local sports store just v hours before sending my daughter off to camp. Spent a fortune on it! Brought it home just to realize it's nothing like the "drawing" and my daughter said it's like sleeping in a prison. She asked why she couldn't have a nice mosquito cover like all the other kids. Those covers are half the price but that store didn't have any left.
review.name: Worst money I ever spent

review.reviewBody: hiking and backcountry camping. would love a side entry option. anther pole for the foot area would make this much better. need to use a tapered sleeping pad.
review.name: I would consider it for staying light when hiking.

review.reviewBody: Guyline locations are a bit funky, don't seem to lift the net off your body unless you are able to attach them to a higher point (rather than in a stake in the ground). Fits my long sleeping bag and long pad with some room at the top for tchotchkes and whatnot. Flimsy poles bend easily, which, if you have wide shoulders means that you could bend some of the net under you, flattening the poles, and bringing the top of the net closer to your head. Worked overall at keeping spiders, mice, snakes, and scorpes off me in the AZ desert, not sure how it would be with mozzies.
review.name: A pretty good desert companion

review.reviewBody: Waterproof or not, you're going to use a tarp if you camp in a bivy - have you ever tried to bed down in the rain without a tarp and realized that all your kit gets soaked and now you have a cold and wet night ahead of you? This is why tarps are essential when bivy camping. That said, this solves the condensation problem that you'll experience with all bivy bags. This bivy is super light, easy to use, roomy enough for my rectangular mattress and packs down to nothing. If you're one step away from no bivy at all, but still want protection from bugs, this is the product for you. Disclaimer: if you're using this in bug season you'll probably end up realizing that you should have brought a tent. That extra room when dealing with an onslaught of black fly's and mosquitoes is peace of mind when camping. In other words, bring the right kit for the job.
review.name: Bivy + Tarp for ultralight sleep system

review.reviewBody: Paired with my Sil Shelter tarp and the shelters I used my bug bivy to great effect to hike the AT in 2001. I used it again this summer in the Cascades and it's holding up after 19 years. Love it.
review.name: Love It

review.reviewBody: So Light! Perfect for warm weather treks, when bugs are your only inconvenience.
review.name: Super lightweight

review.reviewBody: Use it in the field in an Infantry company. It's lightweight, but could use a second pole to keep the net off the skin. Easier to place the poles than to mess with tying it off. I showed it several other guys in the unit who were interested, but agreed improvements would make it more viable.
review.name: Product Improvements Needed

review.reviewBody: I used this products three times twice in east coast and once in UTAH. Net is too close to the body you need extra protection like a sleeping bag layer. If you go in with shorts and tshirt expect to wake up in the middle of night mosquitoes eating you alive. It does not protect from chiggers(no see ums).
review.name: I would not buy this product for mosquito protection.

review.reviewBody: Tried a different setup instead of traditional tent. On my recent overlanding setup I used a cot, sleeping mat and bag, and a bug bivy incase of mosquitoes which I'm glad I brought it. It's my first time owning a bivy so it was awkward to get in and out using a cot. Once I got comfortable in my sleeping bag I didn't even notice the bivy.
review.name: Perfect for summer and by the lake camping.

review.reviewBody: What a life saver. Really essential if you're sleeping under a tarp during bug season. I ripped a small hole in my new bivy the second time I used it by accidentally catching my sleeping bag zipper on the mesh, but I'm still obsessed. A simple patch will fix it no problem.
review.name: Essential

name: Bug Bivy

hasVariant.description: Buy the Icebreaker Granary Culottes - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The culottes are comfortable, warm, and the length is great. It is nice to have the two large pockets. I would order these again.
review.name: repeat piece go clothing to add to you wardrobe

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are the perfect around the house pants. They can also go out to a nice dinner or a rock show. They're comfortable lightweight never get smelly and mix-and-match with everything in my wardrobe.
review.name: I love them so much. I have many pairs

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I especially like to wear these in summer, they are nice for fall too. They go great with some knee high boots. I have both L and M as I am in between sizes and can go either way. L are more flowy and seem to dress up better. M are fit at waist. I have black and algae green. I'd like to see these in midnight navy. I prefer all of the Granary Collection epically the more relaxed fit. Over 60, 5'4 #155..relaxed body type.
review.name: Love granary culottes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have a pair of the (retired) Yanni culottes from Icebreaker which are an essential part of my wardrobe- to the extent that I was concerned about not being able to replace them if they ever started to wear out. Thankfully these Granary culottes are virtually identical to the Yanni except for the very slightly heavier fabric in the Granary pair, and I love them both! It's nice to have two weights to choose from, one for layering under dresses and one to wear as pants.
review.name: Love these super-adaptable culottes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These culottes can be styled casual or dressy. I'm 5'-1" so these are ankle length on me, exactly what I was looking for. I saw light pilling after the first wear but none since.
review.name: LIGHT AND COMFY

review.reviewBody: I agree with others. The fit isn't right. The pockets bunch up and looks lumpy. The Yanni fit perfectly.
review.name: Bring back Yanni please

name: Granary Culottes - Women's

review.reviewBody: I'd put around 3k miles on the original Shimano GRX600 crank including a chain swap or two. I was never in love with how it shifted, clunky. The GRX RX810 is smoother, stiffer, and a touch lighter. I put the new drivetrain (with an Ultegra cassette) on the night before a 3 day bike packing trip and it was money. I ride this bike 3-4 times per week and am loving this upgrade.
review.name: Nice upgrade

review.reviewBody: LOVE these boots! I got them for my 4yo who loves to stomp and play in puddles and mud. She loves them! Amazing soft rubber. I was a touch skeptical at first that the sole might be clunky and heavy, but it's much lighter than it appears, to my delight! My daughter loves them and wears them all the time, no matter the weather!
review.name: Love these boots!

review.reviewBody: My daughter gives these boots a 'double thumbs up'! She has worn them everyday since they arrived, which is saying something since she typically chooses to go without shoes. I give them a 'double thumbs up' as well for durability and functionality. They are well constructed which is good because they will definitely take a beating by my rough and tumble little girl! The material used will make washing them off a breeze and the removable insert will help speed up the drying process. Can't beat the quality!
review.name: Quality!

review.reviewBody: These are amazing kids boots for warmer weather. Our daughter loves them and how easy they are to take on and off.
review.name: Confortable and Versatile

review.reviewBody: Got one of these for my little cousins who lives in Honduras. I have visited them before and judging by the material, it looks durable enough to withstand the environment.
review.name: Durable!

review.reviewBody: Love the grippy tread. Built very sturdy and cute color combination.
review.name: Durable and cute!

review.reviewBody: These are great boots for kids! They are easy to put on, little one can do it herself, and they keep her feet nice and dry. Cute looking too!
review.name: Practical, Easy, and Cute

review.reviewBody: Perfect boots for kids to throw on quickly when its wet or muddy out, but colorful enough my kids want to wear them. Practical and good looking!
review.name: Stylish and Functional

name: Essential Rain Mid Boot - Kids'

review.itemreviewed: Uneek SNK Chukka II Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] If I had tried these on before purchasing I would not have bought these boots. I do not have the problem others had with putting them on, they fit as intended. But they rub my ankle as I walk and the foot bed is not as cushy as I hoped. (Maybe it is unfair to compare them to UGGs for comfort). I will keep them but not LOVE them.
review.name: Warm and waterproof - more like a 3.5

review.itemreviewed: Uneek SNK Chukka II Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I like these boots but they are just a tish narrow
review.name: I like these boots but

review.itemreviewed: Uneek SNK Chukka II Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wish there were more color versions of this model, not just black. I think it would make it more interesting.
review.name: I wish there were more

review.itemreviewed: Uneek SNK Chukka II Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wanted a slip on pair of winter boots. They are very easy to slip on but are still stable on your feet. Even though they feel like they fit well, my feet get soar if I wear them for an hour. I ordered a size up.
review.name: Great design, but make my feet soar

review.itemreviewed: Uneek SNK Chukka II Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Cute boot, but at least a size too small and narrow. Ordered 1/2 size up, which is what I do with all my Keen boots(I have at least five pair currently) Had to return them-sad.
review.name: Disappointed

review.itemreviewed: Uneek SNK Chukka II Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was glad I read the reviews and purchased a half a size larger to accommodate thicker socks. The laces probably make them more versatile - if you want to take the time to tighten them up. I was looking for something to slip on quickly for short trips outside in the rain or snow and they fit the bill as described. You may want to be sure to wear heavy socks and/or tighten up the laces after putting them on if you will be outside in them for a longer period of time as the gap around your ankle/lower leg can get pretty drafty when the temperatures are in the 20's or cooler. The only drawback I have experienced with them is when I wore them all day on a trip, the top of the back of the boot was fairly rigid and rubbed on the back of my leg despite having thicker socks - but that may just be how they fit me.
review.name: Good Boots - as advertised

review.itemreviewed: Uneek SNK Chukka II Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I tried two of Keen's slip on boots. I could not get my foot in neither of them. Can't tell you if it is true to size because the opening doesn't allow you to slip in your foot.
review.name: Another engineer failure

review.itemreviewed: Uneek SNK Chukka II Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: They definitely don’t fit like the Keens I usually get (woman’s PRESIDIO II….love them) They are narrower than I like. But will keep them as my back up boot.
review.name: They are ok- a narrow boot

review.itemreviewed: Uneek SNK Chukka II Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Runs narrow and small. So disappointed since Keen is my go-to for shoes and boots because they always fit! Definitely don’t buy these unless you have Narrow foot.
review.name: Disappointing

review.itemreviewed: Uneek SNK Chukka II Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable boot. Nice to use when walking around as long as it is not in deep snow.
review.name: Very nice boot

name: Uneek SNK Chukka II Waterproof Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Fixes the common problem of delamination with a single piece toe box. The new toe box fits like a glove when broken in. Originally downsized a full size and that was a bit tight.. Although I downsized a whole size down from my street shoe size with the Drone 1.0 the Drone 2.0 feels a little more snug with the stiffer rubber out of the box. Picked up another pair just a half size down and it feels perfect so far. 👌🏽
review.name: Super stoked on these!

review.reviewBody: I think the Drone 2.0 with the molded one-piece rubber (sole, rand and toe rubber) is a step-down from the original Drone. It makes the shoe very insensitive to small holds, and the one-piece rubber will no longer stretch/mold to one's feet. It's essentially the Drone Comp with a  stiffer rubber. The entire time wearing them they felt like clanky wood clogs. The heel fits well still.
review.name: Drone 2.0 steps down from previous model

review.reviewBody: Great overall shoe. Stiff out of the box, but softens up really quick as you break it in. I have more of a medium volume foot, and these fit so perfectly. I also struggled with multiple different models and brands when it came to the heel, the heel would only fit if I downsized to an unbearable amount, but in these shoes I opted for half a size down from street shoes and can comfortably fit my toes in the front of the shoe as well as having the most secure heel I've ever had in a shoe. The concave midsole also naturally pushes your toes into a very natural and comfortable crimp position which allows you to really use them without the terrible pain of downsizing like every other brand out there.
review.name: Most Comfortable High Performance Shoe

name: Drone High Volume 2.0 Climbing Shoe

description: Buy the Therabody RecoveryTherm Cube online or shop all Training from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: RecoveryTherm Cube
hasVariant.description: Buy the Therabody RecoveryTherm Cube online or shop all Training from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I work from home and my job requires sitting at a desk all day. With that being said, I do suffer from back and shoulder pain from time to time, so I was delighted to try the RecoveryTherm Cube. I normally use a heat pad to help alleviate pain and soreness, but wanted to try something more compact. I like that this device is portable and a convenient size. It comes with two straps, a longer one and shorter one, and can be used according to your preference. There are three different settings: cold, hot, and alternating cold and hot. I like the hot setting, but my only dislike is that I wish it could get hotter. The device does help alleviate any shoulder or back pain I may have throughout the day and although it does not get as hot as my old faithful heat pad, it does the job effectively and I will continue to use.
review.name: Convenient and does the job

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Therabody Recovery Therm Cube earns a solid 4-star rating for its impressive effectiveness in aiding recovery. Its ability to alternate between extreme temperatures provides excellent relief post-workout. While its portability is a definite asset, allowing for on-the-go use at the gym, its durability ensures long-lasting performance. However, its intense temperature extremes can be uncomfortable, and the straps, unfortunately, fall short for larger frames, hindering its usability on the back. Despite these drawbacks, its effectiveness, portability, and versatility make it a valuable addition to any recovery routine.
review.name: Therabody Therm Cube: Hot or Cold, On-the-Go Relief!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The RecoveryTherm Cube has become my go to product when I’m feeling sore or sick. The temperature regulates so quickly, and does not have the weird food/plastic smell that you get with traditional heating or cold packs. It can make a loud whirring noise at times, but is so worth it!
review.name: Replace Your Bean Heating/Cold Packs!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This device is amazing! I love the options of hot, cold, or a mixture of both to soothe muscles or painful areas. It is incredible post workout, my boyfriend also uses it now post hockey games.  It’s extremely user friendly and easy to take on the go.
review.name: Muscle Recovery Godsend

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve used heating pads forever. This Newly Designed RECOVERY THERM CUBE Heating/Cooling Rechargeable Portable Device is AMAZING! It has 2 sizes of Velcro Straps so I was able to use it wherever I needed on my body. Not being plugged into the wall or an extension cord left me Free to go anywhere. What an Awesome Product. I used it all over my home, outside in the yard & in the car-On The Go!! Charge lasted a long time, it’s very well made & easy to use. I used it on my shoulders a lot & it didn’t hurt to set it on top & walk around. It’s A 
KEEPER that I HIGHLY RECOMMEND. 😁😄
😀😃
review.name: Use Heat on the Go!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This cube device worked great for pain relief and providing relaxing relief for sore muscles. Both hot and cold options worked quickly, even when switching between them on the unit. The only negative was that the fan was a bit noisy. Unit charged quickly via USB port and would be a great option for traveling due to its portability.
review.name: Works great for pain relief

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was so excited to try this product, and it was definitely worth it! It heats and cools very quickly and is so nice for centralized pain! Already love it!
review.name: Love!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received 2 week ago but I just used it today. What a great product. It is small and portable, with two straps easily to adjust when using it. It has a cold and heat feature. The instructions were easy to follow and explained how to use it perfectly. I felt so good when putting it on my sore muscles and joints. It can be used anywhere on the body and thanks to the straps for support.
review.name: No more ice bag!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was so happy to get this product because I have a knee injury and I need to ice them everyday, however, this was a bit tricky to put operate so I watched a YouTube video and I must say this product is amazing!! It heats and colds super fast and it has different coldandhot temps and can even do a cycle of both and it cuts off after 18 mins! This product is a game changer and it charges with USB-C which to me is the icing on the cake. I only did not give it 5 because of the initial putting it together. Important to note: the fan does make noise but it isn't loud
review.name: A bit tricky to put figure out at first

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I thought the idea of this recovery device was really need, it could provide both targeted heat and cold therapy for aches and injuries. It also came with two straps, one long and one short which were also useful. I was able to power it on easily and select the strength of the therapy and use it quickly. The things I didn’t like were how loud the fan was while running, it’s very distracting and I’m sure there’s a reason for it but I think a battery powered hand warmer would have felt the same. Overall, it was definitely more convenient than an ice pack or a plugged in heating pad but the fan was too annoying to ignore.
review.name: Small and useful hot/cool recovery device but loud

name: RecoveryTherm Cube

review.reviewBody: Love the fit & feel. Will be putting it to the test when I paddle the longest river in North America!
review.name: 4 month river trip!

review.reviewBody: I’d been looking for a good sun hoody for awhile & am so glad I tried this one! I love the large hood that fits over a baseball cap & stays put unlike other hoodies. The large pocket was also a big selling point for me since I’m always looking to stow things.  I’ve mostly been wearing this out around our farm while working & I appreciate that the fabric seems to have cooling properties despite the blazing heat. In a few weeks I’ll be fly fishing the Yakima & im looking forward to it!
review.name: Great sun hoody

review.reviewBody: I did not purchase this for water sports as would most.  I work a lot outside in my yard at high altitude and need more complete coverage…Loving the options it creates no matter where the sun is!
review.name: Lightweight and Great Coverage

review.reviewBody: This shirt is truly amazing.  I'm not a fisherwoman but I am a rock climber. I wore this on a 5 day desert trip: all day sun in 95++ degrees. No sun on my face at all and I was not overheated while climbing. This fit under my helmet and I also wore it with a cap at times. Runs true to size and it a slim fit which is what I was looking for. I bought a small am 5'6"  124lbs
review.name: This shirt is amazing for cool coverage in the heat!

review.reviewBody: I very much like this shirt.  The features of the built in hoodie and neck gaiter, along with the extended sleeves, SPF50 and vortex cooling make this darn near close to being perfect. It’s definitely a solid 4-stars.  I’m one star away from loving this shirt, and making it my “go to, want wear it, gotta wear it everyday I’m on the river” kind of favorite shirt, but… I would really like to have a bit more room in the back of the hood. I have a ton of hair and when pulled back in a bun, braid or ponytail it pulls the hoodie back and in turn pulls the neck gaiter too tightly on my face. So, to give this 5 stars I would either need the hood to have a little more room in the back or have a slit built in so my hair can be worked through the back side of the hood. Would also like additional color options.
review.name: Nearing Perfection…

review.reviewBody: This shirt stays cool and covers so well.  I love the pocket in the back. The color is beautiful.  I wish it came in more colors.  I would love to have another for outdoor chores too.  Maybe in a color I could get dirty in.  I’m afraid this color might stain.  We will see.  All in all, I love this shirt.
review.name: Love it!!

review.reviewBody: Cool sun protection. I wish there were more colors available. My daughter’s favorite hot weather shirt. Well worth the price. Fits a little big but I believe it was designed that way to keep the wearer cooler. Having said that it doesn’t look baggy

name: SolarFlex Cooling Hoodie - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I've been fortunate enough to run this post for the last several months, and good golly has it impressed. Out of the box, the first thing that I noticed is the unique saddle clamp. The angled bolts on the sides mean that you can use pretty much any style of hex wrench to get things fastened down, and the easy access means you can get out on the trail that much faster. Once the clamps are properly torqued, the saddle is totally locked in; even on some fairly hard hits the saddle didn't move at all. 

SDG also includes travel adjusting shims with the post. I had to shim mine down from 200mm to 190mm to fit in my S5 Specialized Enduro frame, and making that travel adjustemnt is super straightforward. What this means for you is that you can maximize your available travel even if you're unsure that the longer version will fit your bike. If you need to bump the travel down by a hair to make everything fit, you can make the necessary adjustment in minutes. 

Arguably the biggest hit for this post, and SDG in general, is the durability. Dropper posts have never been known as the most reliable components on bikes, and while they'vecome a long way since their inception, anybody whorides regualrly has almost certainly had some kind of issue with their dropper. In this respect, SDG absolutely shines. After many miles of fairly heavy duty riding, this post is operating as smooth as it was out of the box, and there is virtually no side to side play in the saddle. The Tellis V1 is one of, if not the , most reliable post on the market, and the V2 simply makes improvements upon that. While not the shortest post on the market, If you can fit this on your bike I recommend grabbing one, as you'll get years of worry free use from it. I can't recommend this post enough, so if you're in the market for a new dropper, be sure to take a serious look at this one!
review.name: Smooth, Simple, and Bomber

review.reviewBody: I've had the opportunity to ride the V2 for a few months now and I am loving it. Swapping saddles and making adjustments with the improved saddle clamp is so easy! The bolts on the side mean I can loosen and tighten the bolts with a Y-wrench with plenty of room to spare. Getting proper torque is important for the clamp bolts, but once it's set up, my saddles haven't budged at all despite some awkward hits on the trail. The rest of the post's setup is very simple and straightforward including the travel adjustments. I have the 230mm travel on my Ripmo (L) and ended up needing to shim it down to 220mm. A couple of minutes was all it took without even removing the post from the bike. The shorter stack height from the clamp and the shorter actuator of the V2 allow the post to just barely fit at the 220mm travel setting with the post slammed in the frame for my saddle height. It ends up bending the housing a bit to exit the frame near the BB but it doesn't impact the functionality of the post or bind the cable. If I wanted the housing to be a little cleaner, I could shim the post to 210mm and just not have the post as slammed in the frame. I love having that amount of travel though! The post is super smooth and has zero side-to-side play after months of use. The Tellis V1 is known for having a stellar reputation for durability and reliability. It's far and away the post with the least amount of warranty claims. I expect to have many seasons on this post without issue, and to me, that's worth the slightly longer stack height and length over other posts.
review.name: Everything I could ask for in a dropper.

name: Tellis V2 Dropper Post

hasVariant.description: Buy the Northwave Spider Plus 3 Cycling Shoe - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I purchased this shoe because I wore the soles off a pair of PI X Alp Elevates riding the GDMBR and general use for a couple seasons. I've had good luck with Northwave shoes in the past, so I gave these a try and wasn't disappointed. I wanted a shoe that I could use for general purpose MTB riding and bikepacking. Something that is durable with a sole that can handle hide-a-bike and is not too stiff. After a season of use and a couple thousand miles these are holding up fine. I like the "not-BOA" system, took a little to get used to, but now I'm a fan. My ideal shoe size is typically a 43.5, size 10, I bought a size 43 and they fit fine.
review.name: Nice Shoe!

review.reviewBody: Great shoe, fits perfect, Michelin tacky soles and like the rachet lace tightener vs a BOA.  Filled in SPD sole openings with Shimano plugs. I was looking for an all around hike a bike, camp and varied soft pack, gravel, road and hard trail with minimal MTB, this shoe is it.  I ride a hybrid bike with pinned pedals since if I leave the roost accidently, I like a quick detachment.  The reason is experience with MX 450YZ and Enduro EXC 500 riding. Northwave did their homework designing this shoe.Its the Alpine Star of Bicycle shoes.
review.name: Northwave Spider 3

name: Spider Plus 3 Cycling Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Last Chair Stretch Insulated One-Piece Suit - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated One-Piece Suit - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love love love this suit. Was having such a hard time finding something cute/not over the top looking, great quality, and not totally breaking the bank for upcoming snowboarding trip. This suit does just that! Super warm yet the extra bag gives room to choose to layer up depending on your temp. Absolutely waterproof, sat in snow for about an hour with no wetness.  Comfort and mobility are also great. Nothing but good things about this snow suit!
review.name: Perfect snow suit!!!

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated One-Piece Suit - Women's
review.reviewBody: Loved loved loved the style and was instantly warm after I put it on, but ultimately returning it. I don't personally think my torso is unusually short, but there was an extra FOOT of torso in this suit and it sat too awkwardly to make these work.
review.name: who's torso this this long??

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated One-Piece Suit - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased this suit brand new from Geartrade, and Backcountry was the seller. I’m 5’3”, 130lbs, and athletic built. Hands down, I love this suit. I tried it on with my pj’s and a sweater, and it was  loose fitting. I could’ve gotten away with an xs for a snatch fit and still have plenty of room to move if I ate it on the slopes. The upper body portion is pretty square and loose, built for someone with broad shoulders. Still NOT complaining, it’s super cute and the belt really gives you a figure so you don’t look like SpongeBob SquarePants. It has a retro feel and the hoodie is big enough to go over your helmet! I’m good with the small as I’m not too picky considering it isn’t that big of a deal it’s not totally fitted like it shows in the model photos. I haven’t worn this on the mountains yet, but it feels pretty insulated and warm. I highly recommend! I hope my size and descriptions help you find the right fit. Hugs
review.name: I love it! Cutest one piece suit!

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated One-Piece Suit - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bravo Backcountry! I've tried in vain for years to buy a women's snowsuit; no luck with common brands or designer brands made for fashion, not warmth. This one ticks all the boxes: an oversized hood that accommodates a helmet, the reasonable pant leg bottom with zippers for bulky ski boots, slimming fit, a belt (to grant me the illusion of a waist), and the flattering horizontal seam across the butt. It's warm, roomy, the rise is not tight--can bend without bind. I'm a classic 4P, rectangular shape, will need to alter the length--story of my life--but I'm impressed with the quality and extras (thumb holster in jacket, slash zip pocket on pant, AND chest and arm have zipped pockets! Kudos to the design team! Well done!
review.name: It actually FITS!

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated One-Piece Suit - Women's
review.reviewBody: I never thought in a million years I would look good in a one piece and than I found this. It is so slimming!!! AND WARM!!!!
review.name: Best one piece

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated One-Piece Suit - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Now I understand why onesies are so awesome! Even in the 80s-90s, I never understood what was so great about wearing a onesie skiing. But I never actually tried wearing one until now, 2022 and I LOVE LOVE LOVE It!!!
So warm and comfortable. I love that this has the straight leg instead of the cuffed leg like the vintage ones, so I don’t look as short. I hope they bring this back in bright colors next year!
review.name: Love it!!!

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated One-Piece Suit - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have this in cold brew/black and wore it to opening day last week.  I stayed so warm while hanging in the parking lot cooking breakfast / drinking coffee / waiting in the lift lines with the rest of the city. The suit is insulated throughout and very roomy in the bodice, and cinches at the waist to make me look like the snow bunny I dream of being. My one complaint would be that there needs to be one more internal chest pocket, so hopefully in future seasons they will add more storage solutions.
review.name: OBSESSED!

name: Last Chair Stretch Insulated One-Piece Suit - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I'm 6' tall, 175lbs and the Medium generally fits well (I'm typically a Medium or very big Small). However, the shoulder straps don't get long enough to fit me properly. Most of my height is in my legs, but somehow even with the straps at their longest, the crotch still rides very high on me to the point where I couldn't comfortably layer and squat in these.

I like that they have pockets on the front of the thighs, but there is just one fairly small bib pocket, and it has a side entrance (all due to the center zip format).

There are no waist tabs for making the waist smaller via velcro.
review.name: Simple function, Awkward fit

name: Sogn Bib Cargo Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I wanted to like this one, but it was polarizing. The things it did well, it did VERY well, but the features that weren't great just failed. Very tight straps, but nailed the material, it was very soft and silky but easy to get off, with a center clip, but it did have a raw edge, looks like it will wear out fast. Love handle area need to come up just a little higher, and ends up at the wrong spot, but no underwear line. Legs had a great material, but not supper grippy. Chaomis: 8/10. Average width in the butt area, but the more padded side. I returned it because of my longer torso, and the weird midsection.
review.name: complete review

review.reviewBody: Theses are terrific bibs. I’ve tried numerous bib brands over the decades, with Giordana FRC being my previous favorite - until they changed the cut several years ago. I’ve been on a quest to find a comfortable bib short since then, with no luck. I have a muscular, athletic build and usually find women’s sizing too large in the waist and too tight in the quads.  I tried the Pearl Izumi (non-pro) bibs and found them unsupportive with a pad that felt like I was wearing a diaper. Not so with these bibs! The pad is thin, which I prefer, with just the right amount of comfort. The material is soft, but surprisingly supportive. The waist is high in the front, which adds support.  The straps are soft, don’t dig in, and are long enough for my longish torso. The legs are long and held in place with a silicon bead on a lazer cut edge.  Really comfortable! The side pockets are a nice touch to hold a gel or chapstick. Rode a rugged 20 mile mtb in these bibs yesterday. I wish I could afford another pair!
review.name: Excellent! Worth the money.

name: Expedition Pro Bib Short - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought this in a different color last year in xsmall and it fit great at the time.  Fast forward a year, I had a baby in October and have been trying to be creative with my wardrobe to find things that are forgiving with my postpartum body and make it easy to breastfeed.  Came upon this dress in my closet, the button-down allows easy access for breastfeeding, but unfortunately, the xsmall became a bit tight around my postpartum hips.  Found it here in small and the fit is perfect.  Wore it to Thanksgiving with one side of the family and will probably wear it one of the days over xmas with the other side of the family!
review.name: Great in general, especially postpartum

review.reviewBody: This jacket may feel and breathe like a softshell but it provides protection from the elements like a hard shell.  Really amazing fabric that is stretchy and soft.
review.name: Amazing jacket!

review.reviewBody: I bought this to replace my OR ascentshell because it was around the same weight, but had better pockets. The fit is good. The jacket is comfortable. The breathability does not come close to OR ascentshell. I have/had goretex, goretex pro, goretex active and ascentshell jackets and this is near the worst for breathing. 10-20mins into a moderately paced tour and I can feel significant moisture build up. Im not used to having to take my shell off, especially while it’s snowing, but that’s what I’ve had to do with this jacket. It just does not breathe well at all. If I could return it, I would. The fit is good (5’10” 160lbs - Sz sm).
review.name: Well designed but poor breathability

name: Khroma Kinetic Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the Goal Zero Sherpa 100 PD (4th Gen) online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sherpa 100 PD (4th Gen)
hasVariant.description: Buy the Goal Zero Sherpa 100 PD (4th Gen) online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Does not hold what it promises (six charges of iPhone) Only able to charge iPhone twice before it depletes completely. 

Would not recommend anybody to spend this much on a paperweight
review.name: Disappointing paperweight

review.reviewBody: I bought this to support my various device while travelling and it’s performed exactly as advertised. One word on convenience: I can put my phone or earbuds on the PD100 for wireless charging. I simply rest my iPhone or  AirPod Pro case on the top — it charges seamlessly as I work. Obviously plugging in can be done but this is way better. And, if I need to power up 2 devices at the same time, I can use short USB cord from the PD100 to the second device which can move around with me, unlike a hardwired cord to mains adaptor.
review.name: Wireless Charging is super convenient

review.reviewBody: I bought the Sherpa 100PD about four months ago for a backpacking trip to Kings Canyon National Park.  I started with a Sherpa that was 100% fully charged.  I charged my Galaxy S22 phone three times (charging it only 40% each time).  On the fifth charge, the Sherpa showed it was 79% full, and once I plugged in my S22 to recharge it, it dropped to 7% charged.  Total failure of this product - being in the Kings Canyon backcountry with no power bank to recharge my phone or Garmin InReach.  This is the second brand new Sherpa that has done this on me.  This exact same thing happened last October in 2023 when I was backpacking in Ansel Adams Wilderness.
review.name: Failed Again

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased the new Serpa with high hopes, as it perfectly fit my needs in terms of capabilities and size—ideal for my backpack. However, I've encountered significant issues with its functionality. The device does not power on, charge my devices, or operate with the cordless charger. Despite attempting troubleshooting steps and consulting the manual, I haven't been able to resolve these issues. Additionally, the charger has never functioned since purchase, even though the unit does power on when plugged in.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I own at least eight different Goal Zero products, 70% have failed on me for no good reason. Bought the Sherpa 100PD less than two years ago, used it about four times and now it does not even take a charge. I am going to try to get a replacement but I am DONE with Goal Zero products. Not dependable at all. I have been stranded in desert with brand new gear that does not work, no fun.
review.name: Another failing product

review.reviewBody: If it didn’t overheat all the time charging a laptop out of the USB-C port it would be great. The older version outputting 60w never gets hot. While the new version outputting 100w get extremely hot and always has the high temp icon showing. As a result often won’t charge till it cools down. So yeah I wish I could still by the older model 😐
review.name: Not as good as the older version

review.reviewBody:
I've had this unit for a few months now and have had some opportunities to use it out in the field all day. Generally speaking, the features are nice. I like the display and readout, and having the different USB ports and wireless charging option is great. 
Performance wise it's a bit lacking. Biggest issue is, anytime the USB-C port is used whether for input or output, the unit quickly overheats. The little overheat icon comes on and it does get quite hot to the touch. This is terrible when carrying it in a backpack while charging a device. 
I also have a Nomad 5 solar panel and it's completely incapable of charging the Sherpa as the battery seems to lose more energy from heat that it gains from the panel. Even with the panel in full sun connected to this battery, it still loses charge. Really disappointing. 
Because of the overheat problem, it really limits how long and often I can use it.
review.name: Nice features but performance is disappointing

review.reviewBody: It is not clear (highlighted) in the description that with the USB charging out put of the solar panel you may get up to 9-10W charge max. Sherpa 100PD may work for someone who will care it only with wall charger, but not for extended outdoor trips where you would use the 20W solar charger. Given poor rating because it does not work well for solar applications.
review.name: Solar charging is painfully slow

review.reviewBody: I have had my unit for 2 1/2 weeks and really love it. Multiple charges of my cell phones while driving my work vehicle around throughout my shift I can probably charge my phone 6 to 8 times before the battery drops to 70% which is fantastic. The USB-C port, however, is the only flaw I have found in my short time having this product. It comes dislodged very easy and if you don’t pay attention you think your phone is charging and it is not.
review.name: USB-C port drops this high quality product down 1.

review.reviewBody: I purchased a month or so ago so I could keep my macbook pro charged while away from power.  So far it has worked great.  I am a little unsure that I could squeeze two full charges out of it, but I have not needed to.  I also have a Yeti 200x and Nomad 50 to utilize also.  I have seen some reviews about the auto selection for input/output.  Mine has worked as it should no problem, but Goal Zero also acknowledges the possibility of this happening and it’s as easy as flipping the switch to your desired function.  It is fairly compact and a little heavy, but I love it and it feels solid.  I could certainly do without the wireless charging function as I have never been into wireless charging.  Everything gets too hot in my opinion regardless of what device or charger.  I wish they had the option to not include wireless in a Sherpa.
review.name: Perfect for what I need

name: Sherpa 100 PD (4th Gen)

review.reviewBody: Fits great and should work great on the boat.  Kind of a medium weight jacket.  I like it.  Ran true to size.

I believe that this jacket and bibs, (challenger series) is the best bang for your buck in fishing. High end style and true to size fit, at a price that's half of most competitors. Simms makes ultra end gear as well but like I said bang, for buck, this is it.
review.name: The best set of rain gear at half the cost of high end

review.reviewBody:
This is my first experience with Simms rain gear.I went on a trip to Grenada Lake and it’s always bad weather there,it’s was a terrible rain storm and I stayed completely dry
Simms Challenger the best!!!!

review.reviewBody: Nice jacket.  Perfect weight for Spring/Fall Fishing.  Breaths nicely, but keeps you dry during a sprinkle or a downpour.

review.reviewBody: Fit is perfect! Haven’t  used in the rain as of yet but it blocks the wind and water spray from wind very well!  Definitely recommend this product!!

review.reviewBody: This is my go to everyday coat. I love the durability and room!  I’m a big guy but still have plenty of room for layers underneath the coat. As per usual, Simms has outdone themselves.
review.name: Another Great Simms Product

review.reviewBody: Great jacket!  A medium fits me perfectly at 5’10” & 170lbs. This is my second challenger-first one flew out of the boat. It was three years old and immaculate.  Recommend👍
review.name: Second challenger jacket for a reason

review.reviewBody: This is a great jacket. I've worn it in some heavy weather and the material plus shape combine to keep water out really efficiently. Highly recommend.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my son for Christmas, it fits nicely, and I’m sure will get the job done, as I know the challenger line will take care of you in bad weather. It’s not Goretex, but like all other breathable/waterproof materials, you have to give them proper maintenance, take care of them and they’ll take care of you- no matter the price point. Some stuff does last longer than others, and outperforms other items, but it doesn’t take away the fact that it works. You are definitely going to have a windproof jacket with this, layer like you would without rain/snow precipitation in the winter, and throw on this shell. It will cut the wind for you. Enjoy!
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: This is easily a 5 star jacket! I’m very happy with it and it looks amazing. My only reasoning for giving this 4 stars is because the jacket as advertised has a little red zipper on the front pocket. The zipper I got on my jacket was black. It’s very minor and maybe not a concern for others, however, I personally think the red zipper looks great and that’s what I was expecting to receive. Other than that, no complaints at all, I’m very pleased with my purchase!
review.name: Zipper color is not red!!!

name: Challenger Fishing Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: A disappointing start for a lifetime of adventure with these shorts. Apart from the pocket fraying the quality is good. Never had a problem with this company before I’m sure it’s just a one off.
review.name: Disappointing start.

review.reviewBody: These shorts are great. They fit well and fabric feels great. The multiple pockets allow for easy separation of multiple items like keys, phone and wallet making everything easy to find. I have laundered them and they launder well. I would buy again and in fact, I did get a second pair.
review.name: Perfect shorts

review.reviewBody: Bought these for a photography trip to New Hampshire. I have trousers from here and chose the same size because they fit great. While they are well built and stitched they run small and have little to no stretch for uphill hikes. For this price point I would really expect better.
review.name: Expected better

review.reviewBody: Purchased these shorts and wore them for one hike.  Rear ripped 3 inch gash during hike.  For the price expected more durable material.
review.name: Ripped on first use.

review.reviewBody: Got these for the summer and they're great. Lets the breeze through, doesn't weigh a lot and the fit is just like the regular Vidda Pro pants,
review.name: Perfect summer shorts

review.reviewBody:
I presumed these were the same sizing as my Vidda Pro trousers so ordered the 52 and they fitted perfectly.

Very comfortable pair of shorts with loads of features. Look good on both the trail and around town.

I'm going to need a bigger wardrobe soon...
review.name: Another fantastic product.

review.reviewBody:
For me, these fit a bit tighter than my size 50 vida pro trousers, which is OK for a pair of shorts and they look great. It does however make the pockets less useful than in the trousers. With the trousers I carry all my dog stuff, bags water bowl, water bottle etc but these do not fit into the pockets of the shorts.
Same great quality
review.name: Good shorts

review.reviewBody: These are great shorts. I purchased EU size 52, the same as my Vidda Pro Lite trousers which are just a little loose on me but I think the size 50 would be too tight, but the waistband on the shorts is about 2 cm larger so they are very loose! I still think the size 50 would be too tight so I'm stuck with the loose shorts. In addition, as someone else mentioned, the Dune beige is a bit bright (and quite yellow looking) so be aware. I much prefer the Buckwheat brown of my Abisko summer hat but unfortunately the selection of colours for the Vidda Pro Lite shorts is limited. I have, therefore, ordered the Barents Pro shorts in Olive and hope these are cut correctly for size and the colour is the nice dark green as it looks in the photos.
review.name: Great shorts but...

review.reviewBody:
I have the Vidda Pro Lite trousers (EU size 52) and they are a loose fit, probably because I am between sizes. I think the size 50 would be too tight and I have the Abisko Midsummer belt which is perfect for making the size 52 trousers a snug and comfortable fit. However, the Vidda Pro Lite shorts are also a size 52 and the waistband on these is about 2 cm larger which makes them quite a bit looser than the trousers! Please improve size consistency and quality control! I still think the size 50 would be too small and I'm not crazy about the Dune Beige colour which is a bit bright and yellow. I much prefer the Buckwheat Brown colour of the Abisko Summer hat that I also bought.

My Vidda Pro Lite trousers are dark grey (which I really like) but I wanted to get a different colour for the shorts and there are only 3 other choices so I have now ordered the Barents Pro shorts in Olive, which looks to be a nice dark green, so I hope they are as per the photo when they arrive in the coming days!
review.name: Good shorts, but...

review.reviewBody: I have trousers shirts shorts  hats backpack and more very good quality love this stuff. We'll worth the money.
review.name: Love fjallraven products

name: Vidda Pro Lite Shorts - Men's

description: Buy the Thule Hull-A-Port Aero Kayak Carrier online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Hull-A-Port Aero Kayak Carrier
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Hull-A-Port Aero Kayak Carrier online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Like the rack but the instructions are horrible. I’m usually pretty good at understanding instructions that use only pictographs but some of these are not obvious to the meaning. Nearly broke the rack unfolding the arm because it wasn’t clear to pull on a leaver. Please add an image of a hand pulling the leaver to open.
review.name: Good rack, horrible instructions

review.reviewBody: Easy to install and has everything included. But it does whistle quite a bit even at low speeds (e.g. 30 mph). I like to drive with the moon roof open and this does detract from the driving experience. Different than an ambient rustle but more of a whistling. Design issue I think.
review.name: Easy to install but whistles a lot

review.reviewBody: I have not used my roof rack system for kayaks as of yet. the weather has changed and would be to cool to go into the water. Assembly of the system was easy. I did take out all the parts and look at the instructions. Partially assembled the system before placing it on my vehicle. It was quite simple. Once i have used the system i can update my review or add a new review. On-line it should show exactly what comes with what kit and pictures should be available as a breakdown. I did purchase items that were already in the kit and spent extra money i did not have to.
review.name: Overall satisfaction

review.reviewBody: Originally bought the simple J-style Hull-A-Port which ended up leaving marks on my Evo wing bars. I also couldn't pull into my garage with the J-Style still attached to my bars. Purchased the Aero's and love them! SUPER easy to install, also fold down so I don't need to worry about my garage. Perfect.
review.name: Easy Install

review.reviewBody: Excellent upgrade from previous Hull-a-Port. Really like the quick release tolower them down and the locking mechanism allows for leaving them on.
review.name: Great upgrade!

review.reviewBody: I purchased the Thule wing bar evo roof rack kit with the ski attachment for a trip around 7 months ago. Everything worked great and very easy to use. I purchased these kayak mounts and they are just as easy to use and worked great as well.
review.name: Easy to use

review.reviewBody: I have been using it for a month so easy to use. No wind noise.
review.name: Hull-a-port

review.reviewBody: Love it. Easy to install and love the lock system .
review.name: Great product .

review.reviewBody: Super easy to install and use. Great quality and great look on my car. Definitely not an eye sore like possibly cheaper brand. Highly recommend.
review.name: Easy Install

review.reviewBody: I have been using the hull a port aero kayak carrier and it’s awesome.  Simple, study and I can lock my key fob in it and just carry the little key to my rack while on the water.  My choice is confirmed every time I see a car with a non folding carrier.
review.name: Totally awesome.

name: Hull-A-Port Aero Kayak Carrier

description: Buy the Cotopaxi Bandera Organic Jogger - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Bandera Organic Jogger - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Cotopaxi Bandera Organic Jogger - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I live in these joggers now! Incredibly soft!! Only thing is they are a little bit big but I bought I size up because I am tall and didn’t realize the M and S sizes have the same inseam. Definitely double check the size charts!
review.name: Comfy!!

review.reviewBody: Such comfortable sweat pants! I changed into my Bandera Jogger right after I come home. The waist is perfect length but hip, thighs, calves are really buggy. So they are not for ladies who want a flirting looking.
review.name: I'm addicted

review.reviewBody:
These pants overall are high quality, however, my pair had many small areas where the stitching on the seams was coming out. 

I was able to get it fixed, for free, with Cotopaxi help - dropping off at store and them sending it out to the HQ for a fix. Then the HQ mailed them back to me. 

This is my first, and so far only pair, of these joggers, so I can't tell if loose stitching is usual for this product.
review.name: High Quality but Stitching Coming Out

review.reviewBody: Soft and medium-weight, these joggers have a wonderfully loose and comfortable fit and didn’t shrink in the wash. I absolutely love them.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: 5’1, 107 lbs. XS was large in the hips and length for me so I had to return. Would be nice to see petite sizing.
review.name: Ran large for me

review.reviewBody: Love these sweats - so soft. The sizing is extremely big around the calves. I’m a curvy woman, so I ended up buying a M and exchanged for a S.
review.name: Great sweats; run big

review.reviewBody: I've been pretty much living in these since they arrived. So freaking soft, comfy on the waist, great length, deep pockets. Perfect lounging pants.
review.name: Incredibly comfortable

review.reviewBody: The signature colorblock makes these very fun. The waist is true to size, but the fit is baggier around the thighs. The fleece inside is soft, but the material is thinner than I expected. Would be great for staying active, but not for keeping warm.
review.name: The signature colorblock makes these

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable jogger! I would down size to a Large one on my next purchase because they come extra roomy on the legs. But I am keeping the pair for days that I feel bloated. I alspnlove the color combination I bought the wine color.
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: Love. Love. Love. My husband joked that I’m just starting to collect bougie sweats and I’m fine with that cause I could live in these. And they’re super cute. 5’11 135lb, ordered Medium and love them!!
review.name: Sweatpants Heaven

name: Bandera Organic Jogger - Women's

description: Buy the Lake CX403 Speedplay Cycling Shoe - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: CX403 Speedplay Cycling Shoe - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Lake CX403 Speedplay Cycling Shoe - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Replaced a very well loved pair of D2 custom shoes with these Lakes.  I was skeptical that the easy bake oven version of $2000 shoes would suffice.  Very impressed that after 3 rounds of baking and molding that these Lakes are 95% as good as a full custom shoe at a fifth the cost.  The speedplay ready soles were great and allowed me to position the cleats more mid-foot then a SPD version would have.  Still some limitations on getting the cleat as far back as I would have preferred but acceptable for me given my D2s were more of a mid-foot cleat placement.  Overall quality of leather and BOA system are excellent.
review.name: High quality and great fit

name: CX403 Speedplay Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
For context, I now own five of the POC Essential Road Logo jersey if that says anything about how much I like it.  They jersey isn’t quite perfect (thus four stars) but for the price I just can’t pass it up and obviously keep buying it over and over.


One very important thing to note is that this is definitely a summer weight jersey.  The fabric, as should be apparent from the pictures, is quite thin.  This is outstanding for those hot, sweaty, summer rides to help regulate body temperature and wick away moisture, but if the temperatures dip you’ll want to reach for a different jersey!  That’s not a knock, just something to be aware of.


The rear pockets are nice size, and the zippered pocket is perfect size for a phone.  I’m able to fit a multi-tool, mini pump, tire levers, a couple spare tubes, my phone, and gels/bars for my rides all without the pockets feeling over-filled.  Despite not having any silicone grippers at the waist, the elastic band does a nice job of keeping the jersey in place without being overly constricting.


The areas for improvement here include the [lack of] zipper garage and the arm bands.  There is a small piece of material at the top of the jersey which, in theory, provides a barrier between your neck and the zipper, but it honestly doesn’t work that well.  A legit zipper garage would be a massive improvement.  Additionally, while the arm bands are extremely comfortable, if the material stretches they begin to become ineffective.  I have larger arms than your average cyclist, so this is a slight issue for me.


All told, these are still excellent jerseys, especially for the price.  There is some room for improvement, but overall still a favorite of mine and a jersey that I ride multiple times per week each summer!
review.name: Essential is Accurate

name: Essential Road Logo Jersey - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Leon Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I ride in coastal and near coastal Southern California ("cool" weather is anything down in the 60s; "cold" is 50s or below) and can wear warm-weather bib shorts almost all-year round. These Santini summer shorts, size Large fit me perfectly on the first try. Light weight fabric, but good compression. Grippy material on the inside, a few inches above the knee. Firm, but not too firm, butt cushion, nicely finished. Shoulder straps are comfortable and unobtrusive.
review.name: Nice quality, perfect fit

review.itemreviewed: Leon Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: These bibshorts never disappoint. Consistent fit, quality fabrics and chamois... and long comfort in the saddle.
review.name: Quality bibshorts!

review.reviewBody: Excellent all around bag for travel. Use it for work and the weekends. Can store camping gear, boots, shoes, everything. Durable so far, straps and zippers are all solid. Nemo did it right.
review.name: Versatile Bag

review.reviewBody: Holds all the gear you could need for a weeks long trip or convert to smaller size for a quick weekend trip. High quality and durable. Also love that it doesn’t attract dog hair like my canvas bag
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody: I bought one of these awesome bags for a 7 day fishing trip to Mammoth and a 7 day trip deep into the Golden Trout Wilderness  to catch Golden Trout and my bag was carried by mule. It easily swallowed everything with room to spare and showed no signs of wear. Upon returning I bought 2 more for future trips and adventures. Highly recommend this bag!
review.name: 70 L Double Haul

review.reviewBody: I use this bag daily to carry stuff to work and I’m glad it can carry a lot of a little based on my needs, it feels a bit heavy and overbuilt but hopefully that makes it last. The huge opening makes it easy to just dump stuff in there and go on with my day
review.name: Fantastic innovative design

review.reviewBody: Car camping? Load it all in. I particularly enjoy finding "walk-in" tent sites that allow a bit more privacy and often have better views, so having something that can carry all my stuff to the site in one trip to be incredibly helpful (stargazer chair, anyone?) It's also great after backpacking to be able to open up my sleeping bag and tent in the car, while still keeping them contained. The tote straps really are a game changer. I don't regret selling my Black Hole!
review.name: It's my everything bag!

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this bag to use as a gear bag for a 2-week long camping trip this summer.  we were going to be moving multiple times to different car-camping camp grounds so I didn't need a lightweight setup, but needed a bag large enough to pack all of my camping gear from California to Hawaii and that could survive being checked-in for the flight.  This bag easily fit all my gear (sleep system, clothing, hiking gear etc.) with room to spare.  It survived multiple commercial flights and the heat, humidity and rain of Hawaii all while keeping my gear dry.  While not fully waterproof from my experience, it survived an hour-long deluge while we were driving in a pick-up truck in Hawaii between campgrounds with minimal water intrusion into the bag (only top items near the zipper were a bit damp).  This bag will be my go-to travel bag when I need a little more space.  

The bag was comfortable to carry and was easier to manage at the airport check in than my backpacking pack.  Highly recommend if you need a larger pack.
review.name: Great for a 2-week Hawaii Trek

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased the Double Haul Convertible Duffel 70L to compliment the 30L and 55L duffels I've used for more than a year. The bag exceptionally well designed and is exceedingly durable and useful for packing all the essentials for a weekend or week-long getaway to the woods or fishing trip to the islands. I expect this bag to serve its purpose for many years to come.
review.name: My Favorite Adventure Bag

review.reviewBody: It's amazing how much gear you can fit in this duffle! I can fit my entire shelter and sleep system in here, along with a couple Moonlight Elite chairs and the Moonlander table. The internal zippered pocket keeps my smaller items like batteries and headlamps organized and secure. The ease of converting to backpack mode is also appreciated when carrying from the car to the campsite while leaving your hands free to grab other things. The only small negative for me is that the storage pouch for the duffel is separate piece and not a stowable pocket built into the bag itself, so it's something that can get lost if you aren't paying attention. Other than that it's all love here!
review.name: This bag is a car campers dream!

review.reviewBody: This is my go to when it comes to packing gear. It’s spacious and carries well when full. Well designed and indestructible. Love the color as well.
review.name: Go to Bag

review.reviewBody: Self-professed gear junkie, here. Didn’t need another duffel, but sure wanted this one. Like all my other Nemo purchases — Fillo elite lux & king x2, Tensor extreme, Dragonfly Osmo, Moonlight elite x2 — the design, materials, and assembly are all top notch. My only dissatisfaction, which is slight, is that the opening does not  really “stay wide while you pack.” In my experience, the duffel needs to be at least a third full for the mouth to stay wide open. I would not have been disappointed by this, because I don’t expect duffels to stay wide open when empty, but for the product description specifically touting that it would. Not a deal breaker at all; far from it. Just a bit of over-promising and under-delivering, in my experience.
review.name: Great, except …

name: Double Haul Convertible Duffel 70L Bag

hasVariant.name: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was between this and a western mountaineering bag (I have used a friends and they are awesome) but the price difference is too big for me to jump right now. This is a great bag for the price. Be sure to store it in the less compact bag it comes in other than when backpacking, as it really seems to help keep the down better distributed. I have mine hanging upside down after a trip as I do notice the down bunches a bit, but re-/settles well. It’s not too heavy and kept me pretty warm with some thermals on during an 18 degree snowstorm. I ended up using the hood side to cover my face and the face flap as a back to my pillow and I found this better ventilated and warmer. I was definitely a bit chilly going to sleep but it was so windy, and it was approaching the bag’s limit. I like the color in person. I think it’s cute. Great bag if you don’t want to spring $800+. I think someday I’ll upgrade for colder nights, but at this point this is comfortable for 25 degrees and up :)
review.name: Great for the price!

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this before a trip to coastal northern BC. It was about 5*C at night and humid. I am a stomach and side sleeper who tends to toss and turn a lot. This sleeping bag was amazing, comfortable, warm and also lightweight! It fit in a carry on pack on the plane, squished down amazingly in a 40 litre pack (just over a 3rd of the space in the pack). I loved the gills and zip locations, the front that has the hood flap was surprisingly helpful to build and control temperature and there was enough space in the hood for a camping pillow and arms while keeping warm. I love this sleeping bag, best one I've ever owned.
review.name: Outstanding choice for stomach and side sleeper

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was skeptical of the spoon shape and how well it would actually work for me as a side sleeper, but it is truly the best sleeping bag I have tried. The temp rating is accurate and the gill ventilation zippers actually make a difference when you are too warm. I run cold and can use the 30 degree bag down to 40 degrees comfortably, which is a huge upgrade considering I was freezing in my last 30 degree bag in 45 degrees. My one complaint is that it is a bit heavy in weight, but I think the extra ounces are worth it considering how great a night of sleep I can get in it. Also, I am 5’5 and the regular length works great for me; I don’t think the long version is necessary unless you are taller than 5’6. I may have to get the 15 too!
review.name: Most comfortable backpacking bag!

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased this sleeping bag primarily because it was "Endless Promise" but have no regrets because it is very warm and better than expected. Excellent loft and comfort. Love the gills for ventilation when needed and the collar for more temperature control. The sustainability is extremely important to me, but paired with the quality I'm very happy with it.
review.name: Excellent Bag

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: As an average sized woman who runs colder this has been the perfect bag
review.name: Absolutely perfect

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’m a talk dude, 6’4 and have always had to compromise with sleeping in bags that are too short. Nemo nails it with the size options and spoon shape that allows me to get the rest I need after long days in the trail, in the mountains or chasing trophies.
review.name: Finally a sleeping bag for me

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love the new sleeping bag so far! The zipper makes getting in & out a breeze, and the colour is awesome!
review.name: Love it so far

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: Purchased for my wife. She absolutely loves it. The heat dump feature is her favorite. Very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Happy Wife Happy Life

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got this recently to replace a bag that was too small for me. I sleep on my stomach so being able to kick a leg up is a game changer. Very excited for the upcoming backpacking season.
review.name: Stomach sleepers dream

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: Finally have a bag that is comfy and warm for the wife and kids. Seems to be a great fit, but looking forward to getting it out in the backcountry.
review.name: Great addition to the arsenal

name: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 15F Down - Women's

review.reviewBody: These are one of the lightest shoes I’ve ever had! Very retro & stylish. They do seem like they’ll get dirty easily but that’s part of today’s ’effortless’ look. They feel breathable, but I haven’t used them long enough to really know whether your feet will stay fresh after multiple uses or if I’ll have to throw them in the washing machine for renewed freshness, but, so far, it feels like they are airy since they’re not like solid covering like leather (it’s more mesh throughout). Overall, satisfied.

hasVariant.name: Never Winter Sleeping Bag: 30F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the Marmot Never Winter Sleeping Bag: 30F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I’m over 6’ tall. Lots of elbow room & a collar, to boot.
review.name: It Fits!

review.reviewBody: Lofts up very well, it's super roomy and warm. I should've noticed this when I ordered it but the bag doesn't zip all the way but stops halfway. It's kinda difficult to get into the bag but not a problem!
review.name: Super warm!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Awesome bag. Good weight and size. When it comes time, I’ll definitely buy another one!
review.name: Good bag

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I luckily bought the long model even though the normal one is for up to 6'. Very glad I did that. 

As my first sleeping bag, I got advice from so many people. Some told me to adhere to the temp rating, some said get a lower rating and just sleep on top of it if it's hot. I should have listened to my more experienced friend about sleeping on top. 

Temps dropped to 40 and I wish I got a bag that was rated even 20 or below. I was wearing just a t-shirt and running pants to sleep and everyone said I ought to just wear more to bed, but I like being less restricted when sleeping. The bag was just enough but would have liked to be a bit warmer. I ended up wearing running pants and a merino base layer to sleep for 50 degrees and it was fine.

The material was nice, soft, and light. I appreciated the zips a lot but didn't get to try the split zip at my legs. Highly recommend for the quality!
review.name: First bag, comfy, well designed, perfect fit.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The only reasons I chose a 4 instead of a 5 are mainly because he hasn't tried it yet. I'm sure it's amazing, but there's always room for improvement. Which leads me to the second point, the colors. We just aren't people who appreciate noisy things. Muted solid colors are our favorite. So this is a little loud for us. But that has zero to do with quality, so overall we're thrilled.
review.name: Nice bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this bag. Just got back from a trip to the desert southwest. Handled the fluctuations of temperature well.
review.name: Durable & Warm

name: Never Winter Sleeping Bag: 30F Down

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love this dress! I ordered for a Salmon River trip and it came just in time. However, the elastic around the waist doesn't seem to be sewn correctly. I ordered a large and it fits nicely everywhere except the waist. The elastic is just way too loose. It almost seems like a big piece was just sewn in and not stretched first. Elastic should shrink and gather the material, stretching as your body needs. As you can see from the pics, the elastic just hung off me. There was at least 2" of extra space at the waist that seemed inconsistent with the rest of the dress sizing. If I could sew, I might have tried to fix it, but at this price and Kavu quality, I shouldn't have to. For reference I am 5'3", 37 bust 31 waist 40 hips, 149lbs
review.name: Manufacturer defect?

review.reviewBody: I got this dress in sunset stripe and it's beautiful. The pattern and colors are mesmerizing and I'd love to wear it all the time. Unfortunately the sizing doesn't work for me. I'm 5'4", about 160 pounds, with wider hips, and usually wear a large in both tops and bottoms. The large fits perfectly in the upper body, but it's a smidge too tight around the butt, which causes it to ride up and cause an awkward wrinkle of fabric around my hips. I also tried the XL, and it is just way too huge. I like loose clothes but it seriously looks like a sack. I think it would be true to size for someone who is more straight up and down through the hips, but not so good for curvier people.
review.name: really cute but awkward fit

review.reviewBody: The Ensenada's wrinkle opposed, quick dry, spandex material is practical and stylish
review.name: KAVU Ensenada Dress

review.reviewBody: I love this dress and wear it all the time. It's breathable, fast-drying and not too short. You can definitely dress it up if you want to or wear it as a cover up, hiking, etc. Very versatile. I'm 5'5", 140 lbs and 34C, typically wear a size 4. The small fits and I kept it but it's the tiniest bit tight around the bum and if you're larger than a C-cup I'd size up to M.
review.name: Live in this

name: Ensenada Dress - Women's
