hasVariant.description: Buy the Continental Aero 111 Tubeless Road Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These tires are great. My favorite feature is the unparalleled wet grip! These tires have the highest wet grip rating on the market which gives me great confidence when racing in wet conditions. Furthermore, they pair nicely with my Hunt wheels because the tires mount easily. These two features alone make these tires perfect for my needs; yet, there speed and aero attributes make this product my new number-one choice!
review.name: Fast, Grippy, and Easy to Mount

review.reviewBody: got this tire for my last ironman and had my fastest bike split !! tire feels very durable while being aero
review.name: Love the new Aero 111

review.reviewBody: Tried on the front of a Hunt aero-wide wheel to see if I felt any difference.  Over a century with long sections of headwinds, I didn’t necessarily notice any “aero-advantage” but less watts of output over such a long distance is very difficult to detect.  I did feel good enough for a sprint-finish as I crossed the line after 8-hours out in the high mountains around mammoth, CA.  Could I really notice any aero advantage?—not really but maybe the gain in wind tunnel tests (by Swissside aerodynamics) could make the difference for someone with power meter or who is very tuned in to their particular bike.  In defense of the Aero 111 tire, I did set several downhill PRs while tucked-in as compared to previous years over the same segments. **Note—this tire is now the Highest rated road bike tire for wet-grip according to Bicycle Rolling Resistance website ** higher rated than their GP 5000 all-season tire.
review.name: Comfortable, grippy—Black-Chili(G)👍🏼

review.reviewBody:
I been ridding on contis for the past 6 years  from 4000’s to 5000’s and gatorskins and never let me down now.

I had my hopes high and I was eager to try it but after a couple of hours of fighting it and using every trick in the book to install it, I came to the conclusion that is not worth the hassle. 

So hard to install it at home with every tool at my disposal, I can’t imagine how bad things can be if I have to fix a flat out in the road, kudos to the efforts in making  an aero tyre but even a Ferrari is worthless if it wont start.
review.name: Super hard to install

review.reviewBody:
Like most people interested in this tire, I've been running GP5K S TR's and have been very happy with those.  As a bigger rider, I generally roll 32 rear and a 30 in the front.  So my observations are only about the size 29.  And I have only had a chance to ride these on my Dogma X.  Here are my thoughts.

I think the 111's is a very different tire than the GP 5K S TR.  

Aerodynamics: I don't have a wind tunnel.  But the 111's are noticeably better at rolling in a cross wind and are much much smoother at turn in (especially in crosswinds).  Going back to a GP 5K S TR size 30 in the front it was very obvious that the front wheel was stalling at turn in (and with gusts in crosswinds) and it tended to destabilize the bike.  I didn't get that at all with the 111.

Ride quality: Out on the road these are not as supple/smooth as a GP 5K.  And it is easy to see why -- just handling the tire out of the box the rubber compound feels stiffer.  And that translates to the front end of the bike.  Dropping a few psi helps.  But it's still noticeable.

Grip: I couldn't tell a difference between the Aero 111 and the GP 5K.  And that's a huge positive as I adore the grip levels of the 5Ks.  Of course, the better grip may simply be due to the better turn in characteristics of the Aero 111.  The 111's do sound like they "squeal" a little bit more loudly than the 5K in a hard lean.

Sizing: These appear to "plump up" more than the GP 5K after a couple of rides.  At 60 psi on my Enve SES 4.5s (TSS, 25mm internal, 32 external) at install the 111 was around 29.5 mm WAM.  After a few hundred km they clocked in around 30.5mm. WAM.  At 60 psi on my SES 6.7s (TSS, 23mm internal, 30 external) a used tire clocks in at 29.0mm WAM.  In contrast, I never notice more than a few tenths of a millimeter difference in WAMs for GP 5Ks between install and end of life.  

In all, I like this tire.  I bought one from the initial run.  And now have another.  So there's that.

As we all know, equipment choices tend to be about tradeoffs.  For me, I see the Aero 111/GP 5K S TR tradeoff as reduced upper body fatigue from not having to wrestle a stalling front wheel in crosswinds.  But that may come at the cost of increased hand fatigue (relative to the 5K in 30) due to the slightly smaller size and less supple ride quality.  You might also get a little bit more speed out of the Aero 111...
review.name: Good tire

review.reviewBody: Felt no difference than any other tire.
review.name: Pricey tire

review.reviewBody:
I saw the tech info on Tour riders and wanted to try this. I've been riding the Continental 5000 S TR for two and a half years and love them (28's then 30's this year) 2022 Pinarello Dogma F w/ZIPP NSW 454.
I did notice a mild increase in speed. That is on a long stretch. For a competitive rider I would go for this. I absolutely don't need this tire and the regular 5000's would be fine but what the heck!
I did get caught in the rain on three occasions. It seemed like these slinged a bit more water in my direction at times. Other than that all good. Pumped right up once I got it on the rim. Since I was running 30's on rear I went with the 29.
review.name: Trying it liking it

review.reviewBody: I have always run Continental tubeless (5000TL and then 5000S TR) I was caught up by the claims and reviews of the difference this front tire would make in your ride so I gave it a try.  My setup is a '23 Canyon Aeroad CFR with DT Swiss Arc1100 62mm wheels (by chance THE wheel this tire was developed and tested on by Continental and DT Swiss)  My first ride on the tire was my regular rout that I have ridden for several times a week for several years so I am intimately familiar with how my bikes perform along that given route.  During that ride I experienced steady 5-10 mph winds (tracked by Windfield App on Garmin 1040) and frequently at the yaw angles that Continental claims the biggest gains are made.  I do not have any scientific data to back Continental's "negative drag" claims but here is what I can say anecdotally - during this and subsequent rides I have been turning in PR after PR as well as my highest average speed on this same 30 mile course in over five years of riding it.  At average speeds of 20.5 mph for a 30 mile ride this tire seems to deliver the exact results Continental claims it will.  Gone is the buffeting one can sometimes experience while using a deep section front wheel, cross-winds and oncoming tractor trailer gusts seem to get cut through to the point that there is almost never any unsettling feedback or wobble in the cockpit.  In the event that there is a bit of feedback (have experienced some over  35 mph) it is minimal and "releases" very quickly.  The fact that all this difference is noticeable speaks volumes to me about the product and what it claims to accomplish.  Additionally, ride comfort and grip are fantastic.  I replaced a Conti 5000S TR 28mm with the Aero111 in a 26mm and was pleasantly surprised that I only picked up a bit of harshness likely due to the slightly lower volume and higher required pressure for the narrower rubber.  Setup was an absolute breeze requiring no levers and just my normal floor pump. I cannot speak to durability as far as puncture resistance or how long those magic little divots in the tread will last, but if my experience with years and thousands of miles on other Continental products holds true to the Aero111, then I will remain a happy and loyal customer.  I will be ordering another Aero111 front tire for my Ultimate CFR in a 29mm to see if the wider version delivers the same results.
review.name: Was skeptical but this tire delivers!

review.reviewBody: I was an avid vittoria fan running pros and control only on my four bikes. Wanted to try these on my aero setup tarmac 7. These are lighter then my corsa pros and I believe they have an extra layer of protection. They are as comfortable ( didn’t think that was possible) and these corner better than any tire I’ve ever owned. Can’t comment on the aerodynamic properties but I have run my best time ever on these. Plus they are futuristic looking. I will be surprised if most of the professionals don’t convert to these if they can. I don’t ever rate products but had to rate these because they are amazing!
review.name: Continental aero 111

review.reviewBody:
Coming from GP5000 S TR in 25c (measuring around 26.5mm), I noticed a tremendous increase in crosswind stability on my 46mm deep front wheel (21mm internal, 27.6mm external). The advertised speed improvements look very marginal except for very particular situations (slow TTs with crosswinds), and I have not tested them personally. In my setup, the 26c measures the same as the GP5000 S TR in 25c.

Bicyclerollingresistance.com confirms that they roll slightly slower than the GP5000 S TR in exchange for a massive increase in wet grip and a slight increase in the tread's puncture protection. These differences are probably due to the slightly larger thickness of a much softer black chili rubber.

These are incredibly costly, but front tires wear very slowly. In my opinion, if it lasts a couple of years, this is the best front tire you can get for most situations (in 29c for most modern bikes)
review.name: A game changer for cross-wind stabilty

name: Aero 111 Tubeless Road Tire
The Amazing Continental Aero 111 Tire | Gear Reviews

review.reviewBody: I suffer low back pain most of the time. After wearing these I noticed no more pain. I have ordered the slides and will be ordering a pair of daily walking shoes.
review.name: Pain free

review.reviewBody: I love Ora Recovery Slide 3. It's the only shoes that supports my entire feet in comfort. Please design a mule with the same design as Slide 3 except with covered toes. Remove the shoe inserts and design it exactly like Ora Recovery Slide 3. I want a pair of mule that doesn't look like slippers when I wear it outside.
review.name: Please make Ora Recovery Slide 3 to look like mule

review.reviewBody: These shoes are very comfortable.and the fit is true to size. They provide all day comfort
review.name: Exceeded my expectations

review.reviewBody: I was hoping this would be the Recovery Slide but with an enclosed toe box. It is not that. Still comfortable but not what I was hoping for. The Recovery Slide are still the most comfortable shoes I have.
review.name: Not what I expected

review.reviewBody: I pretty much wear Hoka shoes, I thought these particular shoes would be great. When I first put them on they felt comfortable, then I wore them and they were awful....they started rubbing a blister on the side of my foot, they were not comfortable to walk in, they just did not fit my foot right.
review.name: No, I would not.

review.reviewBody: This has been a game changer for me. Tennis shoes for good walking support and these for the rest of the day. Totally dampens the pain when walking.
review.name: What a relief

review.reviewBody: Other than being a little too wide, these are extremely comfortable and perfect for my needs.
review.name: Perfect for my needs

review.reviewBody: Love the shoe, but the sole has ribs that are not comfortable. I added a thin flat insole that solved the problem Hoka shoul consider changing the sesign to a solid flat sole
review.name: Good design and fit

review.reviewBody: had a lot of trouble with sizing , had to have other sizes to finally get one that sort-of fits.
review.name: trouble with sizing

review.reviewBody: Been wearing these at home to avoid walking barefoot and they've been great. Very comfortable, all day wear, and feel great on my feet. I work from home, so wearing these around the house has been awesome. My wife has a similar pair (open toe) and she loves them. Totally recommend them!
review.name: Recovery and house shoes

name: Ora Recovery Mule

description: Buy the PNW Components Loam Lever online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Loam Lever
hasVariant.description: Buy the PNW Components Loam Lever online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Perfect and simple lever. Hasn't had a single fault in 2 years of use. Ergonomics are perfect too.
review.name: Couldn't want anything more

review.reviewBody: I own three loam levers.  It's just such a nice, simple design.  It's very easy to adjust the cable length.  It's well made and there is nothing extra or stupid. It's expensive for a tiny piece of kit but it does the job effortlessly and perfectly.  I completely forget about them and they feel natural to use.
review.name: An excellent product.

review.reviewBody: I read the install instructions from PNW website which shows the cable housing and end covers, so was very disappointed when the post and lever arrived and neither included a cable housing. cable wire but no housing!  Makes no sense, especially at this price.  The Crank Bros post I got for another bike included everything, and for a better price.  This set up is going to have to work VERY well (once I go back to town to get the needed parts) before I'll give it a good review.
review.name: They should include all the parts

review.reviewBody:
My seatpost dropper has transformed my biking and I depend on it continually. When I broke the weak seatpost dropper lever I gave this a try based on reviews. Wow! Easy to install and what a difference! 

My wife demanded I replace her lever with this PNW as soon as she felt what a good lever can do. Ordered the SRAM MMX so integrated with my Guide R braking system and cleaned up my handlebars. Very happy with purchase and will buy again if I upgrade my bike. The fact that we can get the rubber contact to match our bikes is just icing on the performance cake.
review.name: Suprised how much I like this lever

review.reviewBody: ... because the levers that come on the bikes are always sucky. Super nice lever and genuinely will make a huge difference in how well your dropper works. It's definitely worth getting. Would consider upgrading your dropper to PNW as well, but not mandatory.
review.name: I put these on all my bikes

review.reviewBody:
This my friends is the lever of all levers. The ace of actuators. The pinnacle of pressers for your opposable digit...it's the best!
The next best thing chews your thumb up like the teeth of wild dog.
This lever on the other hand has a perfect pillow for your thumb. Just enough grip to never slip. The lever spins on a cartridge bearing. While that makes it rotate smoothly, the bigger impact is how precise it makes it feel. There's no up or down jiggle or binding. It only glides through its travel precisely in the intended direction. On top of the excellent machining of the metal, PNW has built in the right amount of adjustments to be able to get the lever exactly where I like it. Not just side to side, but the lever can be adjusted in an out so that your thumb finds it pillow perfectly without any strain. On top of all that, you can color coordinate the colors of this controller to your favorite steed. I love it so much I bought their limited Shifty lever (no longer available) to make my thumb shift lever match this magical bit of machinery!
review.name: I need a 6th Star

review.reviewBody:
included. It comes with the lever and cable, but no housing, which is needed to install this. On the PNW site, they state that housing is included, i guess that is not true for the inventory CC currently has. 

Any gearheads want to chime in on which housing will work best?
review.name: Might want to mention that housing isn't

review.reviewBody: The manufacturer description includes the housing but this version doesn't include the housing. Only comes with the cable, one screw, and mount. Yes I read the description before I bought it. I figured it was a typo. That's why I referenced the manufacturer's website for what is included. Other than that, product looks and feels like good quality.
review.name: No housing...

review.reviewBody: I've used a whole bunch of levers over the years- some good and some just terrible.  I've been using the other "best" lever available for a few years now, and this one just took it's spot.  It's easy to install, buttery smooth, and nicely adjustable.  The little adjuster on the back side that takes up slack and/or adjusts the lever position is an awesome feature.  And I thought the rubber pad was just a gimmick, but it really is effective and puts it over the top for the best in feel and quality.  I'll certainly keep buying these as long as they keep making 'em.
review.name: My new favorite lever

review.reviewBody: The lever itself is great, but it doesn't actually work with I-spec EV.  I spoke with PNW components and they sent me a new ring clamp. but it's rather annoying when you're trying to declutter your handlebars.  PNW said they no longer will support I-spec EV and blamed Shimano for having changed the spec since it came out.
review.name: Don't buy the I-spec EV version!!!!!

name: Loam Lever

review.reviewBody: I have worn this vest for training and a long gravel race in temps ranging from low 40's to 60s. This beat isn't too thick so you can put us over a thermal jersey or a lighter weight jersey and be comfortable in a range of conditions. The size small fits well, I may have been able to get away with an extra small for a more aero fit but overall I thinks it's true to size. For reference I am 5'3", 122 pounds, with a curvy/athletic build. I usually wear small or extra small tips in castelli but I am between size small and medium in casyelli bottoms.
review.name: Exactly what I needed

review.reviewBody: i love how lightweight it is and yet it works well as a windbreaker.   the size chart is accurate.   the small was slim fitting , not tight.
review.name: light but effective

description: Buy the Topeak FlashStand Work Stand online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: FlashStand Work Stand
hasVariant.description: Buy the Topeak FlashStand Work Stand online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The materials are nice and the product feels premium, but it is not designed for a modern carbon road bike, or any bike with a thick bottom bracket and downtube. 
In its tallest form (first product picture), I was able to make it work and perch my bike atop the stand, however the bottom bracket cannot fully contact the stand and the arm comes into contact with the downtube. The stand arm is thin enough that I can spin my cranks freely despite my thicker-than-aluminum frame, but the stand is really not stable at all.
I purchased this so I wouldn't have to use a work stand to lift my rear triangle off the ground for bike washes and I'm sad the design let me down.
review.name: Falls short

name: FlashStand Work Stand

review.name: Perfect for cold weather running in Minnesota. This jacket is exactly what I was looking for. It has just the right amount of warmth but isn’t not too warm. Keeps me dry from both sweat and snow/rain. Perfect length and well designed hood.

review.reviewBody:
One sweet pair of pants!!! But… 
Needs a butt pocket…
review.name: Great but

review.reviewBody: I bought these pants a month ago,and til now i’m very pleased with the pants. For summer adventures is it very usefull
review.name: Very stretchy pants

review.reviewBody: I replaced two pairs of worn-out old lighweight Fjallraven trousers with this newer design and couldn't be happier. They are form fitting, functional and fun to wear. I have worn one of the two pair everyday during my annual 30 Days of Dawn photo challenge, chasing sunrise every morning and these trousers perfomed perfectly. I added a lightweight baselayer for a few colder days but still maintained the great flexible feel these pants offer in spades. TOP NOTCH TROUSERS!
review.name: The Perfect Pant!

review.reviewBody: I've had roughly 3 pairs by now and will continue to buy them
review.name: Best Pants

review.reviewBody: I bought this a month ago and I’m very pleased. Have not yet how to use the wax. I booked trees, choker, set, work in the mountains, logging seven days a week 12 hour days. These pants have held off so far. I wish they had suspender buttons in the back.
review.name: Durability

review.reviewBody: I really wish these pants worked for me. The material combination is pretty brilliant, as the faced lowers and seat feel very durable and the stretch and breathability of the remainder of the pant is great. The main drawback to me is the fit. The pants are incredibly tight thru the thighs, crotch and seat, in relationship to the waist size of the pant. I am typically a men’s 36 or 38 waist depending on the pant and purchased a 38 in these to account for the tightness in the legs and seat. While the waist fit well, the legs and seats were just too snug for comfortable use so I ended up returning them. These are a great pant, but a relaxed version would improve the fit for some of us.
review.name: Material is Exceptional - Fit is not

review.reviewBody: Great pant. Probably the best pants I have ever owned. I use these for elk hunting and my only complaint would be to have a true camo pattern offered in the lineup. The current camo pattern just doesn’t cut it. Also wouldn’t mind a 36” inseam.
review.name: Great pant- need a real camo pattern offering

review.reviewBody: I like the fit and comfort of my kebs. But where I live (New Jersey), there is a lot of vegetation that sports what we call hitch hikers. That's the seedling, briar like, little gremlins that attach to your clothing when you brush against these plants walking. The bad news is they STICK like VELCRO and GLUE to the polyester/cotton stretch fabric and it is a PITA to pick them off! When I say stick, I MEAN stick! It is not a deal breaker for me but I will never wear them again knowing I'll be wading in brush. Otherwise, I enjoy the comfort, ventilation as needed, and they look awesome. I got instant compliments from my snooty brothers who asked about them but we're put off by the price. Don't get me wrong... I truly like them. But be advised...them hitch hikers will fill your dance card around the campfire picking them off for HOURS! Now if you don't mind the stubble as your hands brush against them, you could leave them be and wear them off. Me? I can't stand em. I gotta pick them off.
review.name: Not for brush.

review.reviewBody: Bought them for riding my motorcycle and they fit perfectly, they’re well ventilated and the water resistant feature it’s priceless
review.name: Great features

review.reviewBody:
1 year and 1000 km's on these pants in the woods, trails and mountains, during 3 seasons. 

I had 1 small tear in the bum from shale rocks, other than that, they have been extremely durable. My local Fjallraven outlet has since repaired and waxed them for free. 

The 4 leg vents, when opened, create a nice draft to cool off your legs. 
Also, you can easily roll up the pant legs to just below your knees to cool off further. 

The right leg pocket has a cell phone spandex slot inside which is awesome, the left leg pocket has a zipper under the button flap.

The bottom of each leg has a metal hook inside the folded layer to attach to your boot laces, to keep the legs taut when needed, but is otherwise completely un-noticeable.
 
The 2 front belt loops have extra loops directly under them, for carabiner clips, which I use regularly.

The stretchy fabric (usually the lighter colour of the 2 colours) is incredible and I cannot hike without it after seeing its performance. One can easily move without restriction. 
The tough G-1000 fabric (usually the darker of the 2 colours) is fairly tough and does feel heavy or discomforting at all.

My only complaint is *NO bum pockets* . 
However, a Fjallraven outlet will supply you with color-matching fabric to have another tailor make bum pockets for you.

9/10 hiking pants. (Pricing losses 1 point) 
The free tailoring, repairs and annual waxing helps justify the pricing a little bit. But I recommend you buy them on sale TBH.
review.name: 9/10 hiking pants

name: Keb Trouser - Long - Men's

description: Buy the Rossignol Sender Free 110 Ski - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sender Free 110 Ski - 2025
hasVariant.description: Buy the Rossignol Sender Free 110 Ski - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I’ve been skiing these for 2 seasons now and they are easily the most fun ski I’ve ever been on. They’re a dream in powder and blast through crud and can even lay it down in the groomers. Best freeride ski on the market!
review.name: Best Freeride Ski on the Market

review.reviewBody:
I skied a demo pair of these monsters at Alta and was absolutely floored at how much confidence they instilled in sending it. I’m waiting on the re-release of the Goguen/Mandin/Palm limited editions to pull the trigger and buy my own pair, but you absolutely can’t go wrong with these if you want to up your game off cliffs and side hits! They’re nimble, not too heavy, but firm enough to take as many big landings as you can throw at them. 

I’m 6’0” 175 and skied the 184 length - they felt great! May consider the 191’s but tbd.
review.name: Send it.

review.reviewBody: Look good, and they're comfortable.  Didn't address my numb hands/fingers issue I'm having this year.   Still playing with setup and fit to resolve the issue.  These might work for some folks, but didn't work for me.  Still keeping them in my rotation until I find the right setup.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Got these babies on my bars just in time for a BC bike trip and they were great for all the terrain we encountered. I like the ability to sort of rest my hands on climbs with the flat portion of the grip. Ergon grips rawk!
review.name: Great MTB grips

review.reviewBody: Happy with purchase. A+ seller
review.name: Very comfortable grip for off-road.

review.reviewBody:
I'm pushing 50 and thought that wrist discomfort was just a fact of life of mountain biking, but not so. These grips have reduced that old-guy ache by quite a bit, eliminating it on more leisurely rides. It forces you to position your hands correctly (for whatever type of riding you do the most.)

I'm 6'1" and it took me a couple tries to adjust them to where I like them, but once they're set they're great. Nice and sticky material.

The grips have survived one pretty good wreck so far, though not a direct hit to the end of the bar.

The purple color looks pretty boss against my orange bike, to boot. Very happy with these grips.
review.name: Greatly reduces wrist fatigue in old guy

review.reviewBody: Awesome feel & the orange pimps my ride matching orange cables and frame accents
review.name: Orange ga3 grips

review.reviewBody: I just received this today and immediately tried it on and headed outside...to feed our horses and do farrier work on several. Is a breeze from NW and about 35 degrees. This is ample and able to keep me very comfortable without anything else over top. I will wear this doing our barrel race competitions all winter, indoor arenas, but still need to be outside most of the time doing prep. And of course, this will be used riding my Trek through the winter months also. So is a dual purpose cold weather jacket, and I am confident that it will keep me very comfortable and often will include another jacket overtop doing either of my activities. Sometimes only a windbreaker and sometimes more. I like the vest type double front, which allows another level of ventilation.
review.name: Really good wx protection

description: Buy the O'Neill O'riginal Short-Sleeve Spring Back-Zip Wetsuit - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: O'riginal Short-Sleeve Spring Back-Zip Wetsuit - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the O'Neill O'riginal Short-Sleeve Spring Back-Zip Wetsuit - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: O'riginal Short-Sleeve Spring Back-Zip Wetsuit - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I picked this 2mm Shorty up for a quick wing surfing trip down to the Yucatan. It was a perfect lightweight option for when the cooler winds came in, and packed down surprisingly well in my luggage. 

Overall the suit fit well, was relatively easy to don, and did everything you need a wetsuit to do. The best part however, is the price! I mean for 120 bucks you really can't beat it. 

One note is that the chest area and back panels have a raw Neoprene face out fabric, which I reckon is where the "Windproofing" comes from. No complaints really, but it's not quite as soft on the skin as some Wetsuits I have tried.
review.name: Solid Spring Shorty for an Insane Value

name: O'riginal Short-Sleeve Spring Back-Zip Wetsuit - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Hydro Flask Medium Press-In Straw Lid online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Got them for my son & daughter-in-law. They kept complaining their travel mugs weren’t keeping their coffee hot. My daughter has one & suggested this. They are both very happy. Coffee stays hot for quite awhile. Thanks
review.name: Got them for my son

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The best tumbler ever! Really keeps my water cold!
review.name: The Absolute Best

review.reviewBody: I like that the upper half of the straw is silicone, soft, and bendable but I don't like that it's not adjustable. I think it's too long and I wish I was able to shorten it by about an inch. Unfortunately if I cut it, it won't have a nice rounded edge anymore
review.name: Just Okay

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The original lid was terrible to get off. The little lip is a game changer. I see where they now come with the lip.
review.name: So much better than the lid it came with.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The kids love these on their cups. They always wanted to use mine so I bought a few of these and now they are set! I love that the straw can be cut to fit any size cup. Perfect for car rides when you don’t want them drinking from a metal, or hard plastic straw!
review.name: Kid friendly

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It fits perfectly! It’s nice to have the option to use a straw or regular lid.
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Was looking for a wide mouth lid and this was the closest I could find for my Hydro Flask, I added an extra liner band and it works great now! Hydro Flask needs to add a large press-in straw lid to their replacement line.
review.name: Medium Press-In Straw Lid

review.reviewBody: The straw lid is versatile and allows for the ability to causally sip your drink instead of chugging! Love it.
review.name: Versatile and lovely

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was hoping for more with this straw. It doesn’t lock in the beverage (it leaks) and if you completely close it down the pressure makes it so it’s really hard to get the liquid out.
review.name: Disappointing

review.reviewBody: The lid is fine, well made as usual. My mug is 24 oz which requires a large straw lid. This is my fault for not carefully reading which size to order. I kept it. No doubt I will eventually order a mug or bottle that it will fit. I just keep moving the large straw lid I already have to different mugs or bottles. If a member of your family shakes a lot straw lids are the way to go. My husband didn’t like it at first but now loves how it works. He drinks more water and juice because of the straw lid. Thank you.
review.name: Ordered wrong size

name: Medium Press-In Straw Lid

hasVariant.name: IKO Core Headlamp
hasVariant.description: Buy the Petzl IKO Core Headlamp online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The new headlamp just died on me. Unless it was a coincidence, it happened when I've inserted new batteries wrong way...
In either case, the batteries case is not obviously designed and replacing battery outdoors becomes a challenging task. Especially, when using AAA batteries.
Other than this, the headlamp is really comfortable etc.
review.name: Dies  if you insert battery wrong way

review.reviewBody:
This lamp seemed ideal for my needs of brighter coverage and helmet compatibility, but it's just too small. I wear a 7 5/8" hat size, and was disappointed to see that over even a thin winter cap this will not work out.

Three stars for not fitting all sizes (nor offering a size that fits), and another lost on the battery closure. The feel and fit of the cover just doesn't match what I expect from an all-weather piece of gear.
review.name: Too small for larger heads

review.reviewBody: Received an open box item. Obviously it had been shipped and returned by someone else. Never turned on.
review.name: Dead on arr
comment: Hi Garem!  I'm so sorry to hear about your experience. We are ALWAYS happy to set you up with a free return or exchange in situations like this. I went ahead and reached out via email, we should be able to get you a free replacement or return.

review.reviewBody: No more worries about meeting unexpected animals at night; that's for sure.  This fits well - not completely comfy and stays put - holds a long charge, and is bright, bright, bright.
review.name: bright as heck and nicely flexible

review.reviewBody: Petzl IKO CORE - How to use video
review.name: How to use the IKO

review.reviewBody: This works wonderfully, folds up to pocket size.  It fits both me and my girlfriend.
review.name: really bright!

review.reviewBody: I've been using my new IKO Core for a few weeks now and it's my new favorite headlamp.  You hardly notice you are wearing it because it doesn't have an elastic headband and it stays super secure and stable while running.  The light quality is super clear with no shadows or blind spots.  Easy to adjust and recharges quickly between uses.  I like the lockout feature for when I am storing it in the diffuser bag which also works as a lantern when you're camping.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Truly revolutionary the way the air-fit headband fits on your head. I have a tiny head and was impressed with the range of adjustability. I've seen it on a huge head and on my tiny head and it fits comfortably on both occasions. I love the recharge-ability and can carry an extra Core battery for longer missions! I already have many core batteries from other Petzl headlamps, so I don't even need to buy a new one! I love the lantern feature with the diffuser bag and it works well hanging around my neck at camp or hiking. Reinventing the wheel! Nice work Petzl!!
review.name: Love this new light!

name: IKO Core Headlamp

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased several of these bags in preparation for a wilderness kayaking trip next summer because they have oval bottoms. This allows the bags to stack, making more efficient use of sea kayak compartments below deck. I’ve used SeaToSummit dry bags in the past, which lasted several years of 12 months/yr paddling before needing to be replaced, so expect them to serve well. (In my present location, I plan to wait for ice free water to test them. )
review.name: Oval bottoms for kayak loading efficiency

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Got the 13 litre and it packed my clothes very well on a recent trip. So cool you can squeeze out the air to reduce volume. The shape makes fit it backpacks or luggage better than tubular/circular sacks.
review.name: Packs well

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great product, especially to ensure my sleeping bag stays dry while backpacking !
review.name: Great product, especially to ensure

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] light weight and durable! everything i want in a dry bag
review.name: awesome

review.reviewBody: I used this dry bag all the time for 12 day trips that I lead in the Adirondack Mountains. It rained for 10 of the days on.my last trip and every thing I had was soaked... except the one set of clean clothes I had in this dry bag. I highly recommend this product especially of your looking to conserve space and weight. Also, the permeable bottom makes it sooooo easy to roll tight!
review.name: The dry bag ROCKS!!

review.reviewBody: I use the 8 L bag for my books and journal on canoeing trips and it is the perfect size for that for me and my paper always stays dry and I trust them.
review.name: Great size and stays dry

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The updated Evac Dry Bags are exceptional. The durability and venting system are top notch!
review.name: The updated Evac Dry Bags

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was lucky enough to be chosen to test out a 8 Litter Vac Dry Bag. I took it out on my 3 week multi sport adventure in the four corners area. For my 1st test I took it out on a 6 day solo backpacking trip in the Needles District of Canyonlands National Park. In the beginning of the trip it was used for clothes. I loved how when you rolled it up the air went out of the bottom. It stayed compressed just long enough to put in my pack along with my old stuff sacks for nice secure fit. 
I then used it on a 4 day river trip just 2 days after coming out of Canyonlands. I again used it for clothes to start out the trip. On day 2 I decided to test the waterproof of the bag. I attached the bag to the boat so it would get wet but not submerged. I put one of my sun shirts in there to see if any wet spots happened. It took a nice pounding for about 4 hrs without any wet spots on my shirt. Even used it as a day bag with the shoulder sling for a little hike off camp. Even held some wet gear in the bag without getting my other gear wet.
Overall I'm very impressed with the Evac Dry Bag. I own several other Sea to Summit bags and after seeing how this bag held up, I considering these as a replacement.
review.name: Must have for any adventure

review.reviewBody:
I’ve been using the 8L Evac Dry Bag on spring hikes and snowshoes to keep my extra layers dry and protected inside my pack. While it’s larger than I need for this purpose, it’s a versatile size because it can also fit either my 30-degree or 10-degree bag for multi-day trips, and it's super lightweight. It’s not a compression bag, but the eVent design allows you to squeeze out the air after packing to take up less volume. The fact that it's waterproof gives it an edge over my water-resistant Ultra-Sil Compression Sack, and I'll probably switch to the Evac on most trips. The 8L Evac bag will compress my sleeping bag to a similar volume as my small (10L?) Ultra-Sil Compression Sack, but it must be constrained to prevent it from reinflating. Weight for these two bags is essentially the same.

I can’t speak to its durability yet, but I’ll update my review after it’s gotten more use. Also should mention that I love the bright blue color!
review.name: versatile and lightweight

review.reviewBody: I have used a lot of dry bags and some have not lasted long and the seams are not fully waterproof but this dry bag is great! I use it to keep books and the items dry while canoeing.
review.name: Durable and keeps my stuff dry!

name: Evac Dry Bag

The shoe itself is pretty narrow (my feet are not considered wide)-so when I put them on it felt like my feet were stuffed into them- felt like I was one of Cinderella's stepsisters trying on her ill-fitting glass slippers!  Plus the strap across the top of the toes has no padding- so it rubbed and hurt the top of my foot- without even taking a step.  Bummed as I thought these were really cool- had to send back. review.reviewBody: Worked well on a mid February hike in the mountains of Arkansas.
review.name: Works well

review.reviewBody:
General Use:
This is a great jacket for several reasons.  It is compact and folds nicely into a storage pocket.  It is very warm and comfortable wear.  To be fair I use it mostly as an additional under layer.  I do this mainly because the snaps don't work as well in keeping out the wind.  I have found that if I use this under a Puffer Jacket I get too warm at least into the 20s F.
Traveling:
This jacket is compact and stores into a 8x4x3 inch pouch, which is a zipped pocket in the interior of the Jacket.  This will be my extra layer when I travel even in the summer when occasionally the weather get a little chill in some regions of the world.
Exercising:
I do use it as an outer layer when running or walking because the snaps do allow some cooling air in.  If it is cold where I don't want vented air I just use a windbreaker like jacket as the outer layer.  The jacket has plenty enough down to keep me warm down to at least the 20s F.  Maybe lower I just haven't had the occasion to use it at that temperature.
review.name: Very warm and compact

review.reviewBody: Warm, light, packable. Not much more you can ask for!
review.name: Perfect puffy

review.reviewBody: Excellent jacket. Zero felt wind on a motorcycle at 75 mph on a 40 degree Celsius day.
review.name: Ghost Whisperer jacket

review.reviewBody: Very warm jacket for how light it is. Warmth to weight ratio has to be comparable or unbeatable. I don’t think it would be a stand alone jacket under 30 per say but possibly with adequate base layers.
review.name: Gracious

review.reviewBody: Extremely light weight and small pack size.  Bought as a travel, pack-jacket to go with ultra light rain shell and ultra light down vest.  Very warm, but also snug fit.  Used it in cold (5 C) heavy rain, with a shell, in Eastern Europe recently and I was completely warm and dry.  Probably would buy the full zip next time, the plastic snaps seem fragile and are awkward to line up in the dark
review.name: very warm, packs small

review.reviewBody: I got this on sale and I’m glad I did. The snaps took some getting used to but it’s a great down jacket and I got it for a good price. I’d buy it again if I lost it.
review.name: Nice and light but warm enough
